value.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

value.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
value.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use RBAC to manage access to resources in Azure.

images.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Use API management to control who uses your APIs, to enforce usage policies, and to present a professional front-end to developers using the API.

images.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt:
API Management policies are configurable modules that you can add to APIs to change
their behaviors. Policies can do things like cache responses, transform documents and values,
call webhooks for notification or audit purposes, and retry requests after transient
failures. This module will use policies to enable caching in order to improve API performance
under load.

images.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

images.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

images.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how Site Reliability Engineering enables you to sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. They’ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.

images.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability
Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

value.title: Build JavaScript applications with Node.js
value.excerpt: Node.js provides a large set of built-in APIs that help you build various types of applications, command-line apps, web apps, and more. It also offers testing and debugging capabilities and a rich ecosystem of third-party packages that you can easily add to your application.

topItems.title: Introduction to Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Learn everything about Node.js: what it is, how does it work and when to use it.

topItems.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
topItems.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project.

topItems.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly.

topItems.title: Work with files and directories in a Node.js app
topItems.excerpt: Build an app that manipulates files and directories with Node.js.

value.title: Data engineering with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run large data engineering workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

images.title: Spark architecture fundamentals

topItems.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

images.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
Describe Azure Databricks

value.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.excerpt: In this module, we discuss how to create a Linux virtual machine using the Azure portal.

images.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure

value.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Secure internal resources, external resources, SaaS applications, and more by using Azure Active Directory. Learn about the features and capabilities of Azure AD.

images.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

value.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

images.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure technologies that analyze text and images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data. See how data engineers can choose the technologies that meet their business needs and scale to meet demand securely.

images.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform

value.title: AI business school for healthcare
value.excerpt: Decision-makers in healthcare have considerations that are particular to their industry to help them realize the true transformational impact of AI in the enterprise. This learning path is designed for healthcare industry decision-makers to illustrate the true transformational impact of AI in the enterprise.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: AI has the capacity to empower the whole world to achieve more. From empowering technical development teams to mobilizing an entire organization to unlock the true potential of AI, enterprises need to think strategically about AI – and they need to start today.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare
topItems.excerpt: To realize the true transformational impact of AI in the healthcare sector, decision-makers must consider the special factors that apply only to their industry. To create real business value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. Becoming an AI-ready organization requires a fundamental transformation in how you do things, how employees relate to each other, what skills they have, and what processes and principles guide your behaviors. This unit is designed to help you understand which are the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and proposes a framework to drive that change in your organization.

images.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: This module is designed for finance and affiliated business decision-makers to illustrate the impact of making strategic decisions with AI. The goal is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
Define an AI strategy to create business value

value.title: Automate your workflow with GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how GitHub Actions enables you to automate your software development cycle and deploy applications to Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

images.title: Introduction to GitHub

topItems.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

images.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions

topItems.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

images.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions

topItems.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

images.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
Introduction to GitHub

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer learning path
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how data systems are evolving and how the changes affect data professionals. Explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions, and consider sample business cases that apply cloud technologies.

images.title: Understand the evolving world of data

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure technologies that analyze text and images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data. See how data engineers can choose the technologies that meet their business needs and scale to meet demand securely.

images.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer. Find out how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI professionals. Explore common data engineering practices and a high-level architecting process for a data-engineering project.

images.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
Understand the evolving world of data

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: Explore how the world of data has evolved and how the advent of cloud technologies is providing new opportunities for business to explore. You will learn the various data platform technologies that are available, and how a Data Engineer can take advantage of this technology to an organization benefit.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how data systems are evolving and how the changes affect data professionals. Explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions, and consider sample business cases that apply cloud technologies.

images.title: Understand the evolving world of data

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure technologies that analyze text and images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data. See how data engineers can choose the technologies that meet their business needs and scale to meet demand securely.

images.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer. Find out how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI professionals. Explore common data engineering practices and a high-level architecting process for a data-engineering project.

images.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
Understand the evolving world of data

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

images.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

images.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: The IoT Central REST API lets you manage applications programmatically. For example, you can add device templates, create devices, set device properties, send commands to devices, and manage data exports.

images.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from the "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you control a refrigerated truck. This module adds continuous data export to both Blob storage, and an Event Hub. Then, a Power BI app is built to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

images.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
Create your first Azure IoT Central app

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM Security
value.excerpt: This learning path deals with securing your Azure resources. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to determine if your Azure IaaS workloads have any security vulnerabilities, and remediate those potential security vulnerabilities.

topItems.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).

topItems.title: Manage Azure updates
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to enable Azure Update Management, deploy updates, review an update assessment, and manage updates for your Azure VMs.

topItems.title: Configure BitLocker disk encryption for Windows IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to configure Azure Disk Encryption for Windows IaaS VMs and back up and recover encrypted data.

topItems.title: Implement change tracking and file integrity monitoring for Windows IaaS VMs
topItems.excerpt: Implement change tracking and file integrity monitoring for Windows IaaS VMs

value.title: Learn the business value of Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt:
Are you interested in learning about the cloud in an easy to understand way? Or perhaps you are confused about where to begin with cloud technology?
This learning experience will take you on  a journey that will begin by showing you how digital transformation and the power of the cloud can transform your business. We will cover how Microsoft Azure cloud services can power your organization on a trusted cloud platform. Finally, we will wrap up by illustrating how to make this journey real for your organization.
In this learning path, you will learn about:

Enabling digital transformation.
Identifying ways to migrate and modernize applications.
Gaining insights through data, artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT)
Meeting a broad set of regulatory and compliance standards on a trusted cloud platform.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure solutions
topItems.excerpt: Begin digital transformation by exploring why Azure is the right platform for your organization and the value Azure can bring. See how Azure enables you to empower employees, engage customers, optimize operations, and transform products.

images.title: Introduction to Azure solutions

topItems.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Every modern business is powered by applications, such as internal procurement applications, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, retail websites, and third-party products. As your business prepares for digital transformation, it’s important to begin modernizing and migrating your applications and infrastructure to the cloud. Azure is a key component of that process. You can choose to migrate, modernize, or build cloud native solutions depending on your business goals and how you assess your application portfolio. This is a strategic decision. You’ll be able to choose the path that’s right for your organization.

images.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Establishing a modern data estate is a foundational step toward digital transformation. A modern data estate enables timely insights and decision making across all your data, and sets the foundation for AI. A data estate is all of the data an organization owns. When you migrate this data to the cloud or modernize your environment on-premises you can gain important insights to fuel innovation.

images.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure AI and demonstrates how Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure can help make AI real for your organization, whether you want to unlock insights from your latent data with knowledge mining, develop your own AI models with machine learning, or build immersive apps using AI.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
Introduction to Azure solutions

value.title: Monitor and optimize operational resources in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Configure hardware and server resources for optimum performance after establishing a baseline. Identify sources of performance problems. Troubleshoot using Azure SQL Intelligent Insights.

topItems.title: Describe performance monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Compare Azure and on-premises tools for monitoring and measuring performance. Determine critical metrics. Understand the purpose of a baseline for comparative analysis.

topItems.title: Explore causes of performance issues
topItems.excerpt: Explore the Query Store for tracking down problematic queries. Understand how SQL Server and Azure SQL manage currency by locking and blocking, or by using snapshots. Implement fragmentation checks and defragmentation.

topItems.title: Configure SQL Server resources for optimal performance
topItems.excerpt: Choose the appropriate size and storage options for your Azure SQL databases. Configure server resources such as tempdb. Understand the usage of Resource Governor.

topItems.title: Configure databases for performance
topItems.excerpt: Control database-level configuration options. Explore Intelligent Query Processing. Configure Open Source databases for optimum performance.

value.title: SAP certified offerings for Azure
value.excerpt: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to understand how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will provide the basis for running SAP workloads in Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: With the recently expanded partnership between Microsoft and SAP, you can run SAP applications across development, test, and production scenarios in Azure, taking advantage of the scalability, flexibility, and cost savings of Microsoft Azure.

images.title: Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads

topItems.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you explore the platform compliance criteria that is stipulated by SAP for deploying SAP solutions in Azure. In addition, you will look at the options for deploying SAP in Azure.

images.title: Deploy SAP certified offerings on Azure

topItems.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: There are many SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs. In this module, you will review the SAP recommended support products for VM types and the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

images.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads

topItems.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
topItems.excerpt: SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non-shared host/server bare-metal hardware.

images.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
Introduction to Azure for SAP workloads

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of virtualization technology and how it is used in the cloud
Learn a formal definition of virtualization and its different types
Understand how CPUs are virtualized
Understand how memory is virtualized
Understand how I/O is virtualized
Understand how storage and networking is virtualized

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Assess your existing software development process
value.excerpt: Use a value stream map to help you examine your existing processes and technologies.

images.title: Assess your existing software development process

value.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions
value.excerpt: Learn how to orchestrate a long-running workflow as a set of activities using Durable Functions.

images.title: Create a long-running serverless workflow with Durable Functions
